field.label: Enable siproxd service
field.help: This will activate the siproxd service.

field.label: Inbound interface
field.help: Select the interface where your SIP requests come from.

field.label: Outbound interface
field.help: Select the interface where your SIP requests are going to.

field.label: Host outbound
field.help: Only use in a double nat scenario where SIP don't know your external public address. Format is CSV without spaces and CIDR, like 192.168.0.0/24,10.0.0.0/8.

field.label: Hosts to allow registration
field.help: Please specify the internal networks allowed to register here. Leave empty to allow every device. Format is CSV without spaces and CIDR, like 192.168.0.0/24,10.0.0.0/8.

field.label: Hosts to allow SIP
field.help: Here you specify the devices allowed to do SIP connections to siproxd (internal and external). Format is CSV without spaces and CIDR, like 192.168.0.0/24,10.0.0.0/8.

field.label: Host to deny SIP
field.help: Here you specify the networks disallowed to do SIP connections to siproxd. It has a higher priority than 'Hosts to allow SIP'.

field.label: SIP listen port
field.help: SIP port the service use, default of 5060 is perfectly fine.

field.label: RTP port low
field.help: Beginning of the port range RTP may use.

field.label: RTP port high
field.help: Ending of the port range RTP may use.

field.label: RTP DSCP
field.help: DSCP value to set for RTP packets.

field.label: SIP DSCP
field.help: DSCP value to set for SIP packets.

field.label: RTP input dejitter
field.help: De-Jitter inbound packets in ms (default is disabled).

field.label: RTP output dejitter
field.help: De-Jitter outbound packets in ms (default is disabled).

field.label: Enable Proxy authentication
field.help: Whether or not to enable authentication for clients to Siproxd. If checked please set up clients in the users tab.

field.label: TCP timeout
field.help: Time in seconds when an inactive TCP session will be disconnected.

field.label: TCP connect timeout
field.help: Time in milli seconds siproxd should wait until the connection is established.

field.label: TCP keepalive
field.help: Time in seconds how often siproxd should send an empty Sip-Keep-Alive to hold the connection.

field.label: Useragent string
field.help: Siproxd will masquerade the interal UAs to this given string (optional).

field.label: Remote ports in VIA-Header
field.help: This setting is only relevant for double nat scenarios, where default port 5060 would be replaced by a NAT device.

field.label: Enable defaulttarget plugin
field.help: Enable or disable the defaulttarget plugin.

field.label: Enable defaulttarget logging
field.help: Enable logging of defaulttarget plugin.

field.label: Default target account
field.help: Redirect all incoming calls to a given SIP-URI with format sip:internal@ip:port.

field.label: Enable fix_bogus_via plugin
field.help: Enable or disable the fix_bogus_via plugin.

field.label: Networks to replace VIA-Header
field.help: Give here a list of networks to replace the VIA-Header. Default should fit for most situations.

field.label: Enable fix_DTAG_networks plugin
field.help: Enable or disable the fix_DTAG_networks plugin.

field.label: DTAG servers
field.help: List of networks where to apply the DTAG fix. Default should fit for most situations.

field.label: Enable fbox_anoncall_networks plugin
field.help: Enable or disable the fix_DTAG_networks plugin.

field.label: Network list for fbox anoncall plugin
field.help: List of networks where to apply the FritzBox Anoncall plugin. Default should fit for most situations.

field.label: Enable STUN plugin
field.help: Enable or disable the STUN plugin.

field.label: STUN server
field.help: Here you can set the FQDN of your STUN server.

field.label: STUN port
field.help: Here you can set the port of your STUN server.

field.label: STUN period
field.help: With STUN periond you can set the time in seconds how often to request for IP info from STUN server.
